research.title: Using Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KAN) and Evolutionary Game Theory in Understanding Cancer Dynamics
research.description: Currently exploring the synergy between KAN neural architectures and Evolutionary Game Theory (EGT) as part of a data-intensive systems study. [cite_start]This work begins by modeling cellular interactions via known dynamical systems such as Lotka-Volterra equations, with the goal of scaling to complex, high-dimensional cancer datasets. [cite: 1]
research.relevance: This research is critical for personalized medicine. Unlike standard 'black-box' neural networks, KANs provide better interpretability for clinical use. [cite_start]By modeling cancer as an evolutionary game, we can predict how tumors adapt to treatment, allowing doctors to shift from static protocols to dynamic, patient-specific therapies that anticipate resistance before it happens. [cite: 1]
